menu.name: Cappuccino
menu.desc: Espresso with steamed milk and foam, topped with a sprinkle of cocoa powder.
menu.ingredients: Espresso, steamed milk, milk foam, cocoa powder
menu.prep: Brew a shot of espresso, steam milk until velvety, then combine and top with foam.
menu.origin: Originated in Italy, popular worldwide as a breakfast coffee.

menu.name: Flat White
menu.desc: Velvety steamed milk poured over a strong ristretto shot for a balanced cup.
menu.ingredients: Ristretto, steamed milk
menu.prep: Pull a ristretto shot, steam milk to a fine microfoam, pour gently to blend.
menu.origin: Developed in Australia/New Zealand in the 1980s.

menu.name: Cold Brew
menu.desc: Smooth, low-acidity cold brewed coffee served over ice.
menu.ingredients: Coarsely ground coffee, cold water
menu.prep: Steep coarse grounds in cold water for 12–18 hours, strain, serve over ice.
menu.origin: Cold-brewing has been used for centuries; modern popularity rose in specialty coffee shops.

menu.name: Caramel Latte
menu.desc: Sweet caramel syrup blended with espresso and steamed milk for a smooth, sweet latte.
menu.ingredients: Espresso, steamed milk, caramel syrup, whipped cream (optional)
menu.prep: Brew espresso, add caramel syrup, steam milk and combine. Top with whipped cream if desired.
menu.origin: A modern coffeehouse favorite combining espresso with flavored syrup.

menu.name: Mocha
menu.desc: A rich combination of espresso, steamed milk, and chocolate syrup topped with whipped cream.
menu.ingredients: Espresso, steamed milk, chocolate syrup, whipped cream
menu.prep: Brew espresso, mix with chocolate syrup, steam milk, combine, top with whipped cream.
menu.origin: Named after the Yemeni port of Mocha, famous for coffee and cocoa.

menu.name: Latte Macchiato
menu.desc: Steamed milk 'stained' with a shot of espresso, creating a layered effect.
menu.shortDesc: Elegant and creamy with a bold coffee kick.
menu.ingredients: Steamed milk, espresso
menu.prep: Steam milk until frothy, pour into a glass, and add a shot of espresso.
menu.origin: Originated in Italy, popularized in Europe and beyond.

menu.name: Affogato
menu.desc: A scoop of vanilla gelato 'drowned' with a shot of hot espresso.
menu.shortDesc: A delightful dessert combining coffee and ice cream.
menu.ingredients: Vanilla gelato, espresso
menu.prep: Place a scoop of vanilla gelato in a glass and pour hot espresso over it.
menu.origin: Originated in Italy, a popular after-dinner treat.

menu.name: Vietnamese Egg Coffee
menu.desc: A rich and creamy coffee made with egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, and robusta coffee.
menu.shortDesc: A sweet and velvety coffee experience.
menu.ingredients: Egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, robusta coffee
menu.prep: Whisk egg yolks with sweetened condensed milk, brew robusta coffee, and combine.
menu.origin: Originated in Vietnam, a unique coffee tradition.

menu.name: Blueberry Muffin
menu.desc: Freshly baked muffin bursting with juicy blueberries and a buttery crumb.
menu.ingredients: Flour, sugar, butter, eggs, blueberries, baking powder
menu.prep: Mix dry and wet ingredients separately, combine, fold in blueberries, bake at 180°C for ~20 mins.
menu.origin: Popular in American bakeries since the early 1900s.

menu.name: Chocolate Brownie
menu.desc: Rich, gooey chocolate brownie with a crackly top.
menu.ingredients: Dark chocolate, butter, sugar, eggs, flour
menu.prep: Melt chocolate with butter, fold in sugar and eggs, add flour, bake until set.
menu.origin: An American classic — fudgy and universally loved.

menu.name: Butter Croissant
menu.desc: Flaky, buttery pastry with delicate layers and a golden crust.
menu.ingredients: Flour, butter, yeast, sugar, salt
menu.prep: Layer dough with butter through repeated folding, proof, and bake until golden.
menu.origin: French pastry dating back to the 19th century.

menu.name: Cinnamon Roll
menu.desc: Soft, sweet roll filled with cinnamon sugar and drizzled with icing.
menu.ingredients: Flour, sugar, butter, cinnamon, yeast, icing sugar
menu.prep: Prepare dough, roll with cinnamon sugar filling, bake, drizzle with icing.
menu.origin: Originated in Sweden as “kanelbulle,” popular worldwide.

menu.name: Danish Pastry
menu.desc: Flaky, buttery pastry often filled with fruit or cream cheese.
menu.shortDesc: Sweet and indulgent with a crispy texture.
menu.ingredients: Flour, butter, sugar, yeast, fruit or cream cheese filling
menu.prep: Roll out dough, add filling, fold, and bake until golden.
menu.origin: Originated in Denmark, a popular breakfast item.

menu.name: Scones
menu.desc: Light, crumbly baked goods, often served with clotted cream and jam.
menu.shortDesc: Perfect for tea time or a light snack.
menu.ingredients: Flour, butter, sugar, milk, baking powder
menu.prep: Mix ingredients, shape dough, and bake until golden.
menu.origin: Originated in the United Kingdom, a staple in British tea culture.

menu.name: Bagels
menu.desc: Chewy, round bread with a hole in the middle, often topped with seeds.
menu.shortDesc: Great for breakfast or a quick snack.
menu.ingredients: Flour, water, yeast, salt, sugar
menu.prep: Boil dough rings briefly before baking until golden.
menu.origin: Originated in Poland, popularized in the United States.

menu.name: Grilled Chicken Sandwich
menu.desc: Juicy grilled chicken breast served on a toasted bun with lettuce, tomato, and mayo.
menu.ingredients: Chicken breast, lettuce, tomato, bun, mayonnaise
menu.prep: Grill chicken, toast bun, assemble with toppings.
menu.origin: Inspired by American deli sandwiches.

menu.name: Veggie Wrap
menu.desc: Fresh mixed vegetables, hummus, and greens wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla.
menu.ingredients: Tortilla, hummus, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, bell peppers
menu.prep: Spread hummus on tortilla, add veggies, and roll tightly.
menu.origin: Popular in Mediterranean-inspired cuisine.

menu.name: Chicken Burger
menu.desc: Grilled chicken patty with cheese, lettuce, tomato, and pickles on a toasted bun.
menu.ingredients: Chicken patty, cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, bun
menu.prep: Grill patty, toast bun, assemble burger with toppings.
menu.origin: Classic American-style burger.

menu.name: Caesar Salad
menu.desc: Crisp romaine lettuce tossed with Caesar dressing, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
menu.shortDesc: Refreshing salad with a creamy dressing.
menu.ingredients: Romaine lettuce, Caesar dressing, croutons, Parmesan cheese
menu.prep: Toss lettuce with dressing, top with croutons and cheese.
menu.origin: Originated in Mexico, popularized in the United States.

menu.name: Chicken Parmesan
menu.desc: Breaded chicken breast baked with marinara sauce and melted cheese, served with pasta.
menu.ingredients: Chicken breast, breadcrumbs, marinara sauce, mozzarella, Parmesan, pasta
menu.prep: Bread and fry chicken, top with sauce and cheese, bake, serve with pasta.
menu.origin: Italian-American cuisine classic.

menu.name: Garlic Bread
menu.desc: Toasted bread with garlic butter and herbs.
menu.shortDesc: Crispy, aromatic, and perfect as a side.
menu.ingredients: Bread, butter, garlic, parsley
menu.prep: Spread garlic butter on bread, toast until golden.
menu.origin: Italian-inspired side dish.

menu.name: Avocado Toast
menu.desc: Smashed avocado on toasted sourdough with chili flakes and olive oil.
menu.ingredients: Sourdough, avocado, chili flakes, olive oil, salt
menu.prep: Toast bread, smash avocado with lemon and salt, assemble and finish with chili flakes and oil.
menu.origin: Modern brunch favorite with roots in California cuisine.

menu.name: Eggs Benedict
menu.desc: Poached eggs on toasted English muffins with ham and hollandaise sauce.
menu.ingredients: Eggs, English muffins, ham, butter, lemon juice, vinegar
menu.prep: Poach eggs, toast muffins, layer with ham, pour hollandaise sauce.
menu.origin: Created in New York in the late 1800s.

menu.name: Buttermilk Pancakes
menu.desc: Fluffy pancakes served with butter and maple syrup.
menu.ingredients: Flour, eggs, buttermilk, sugar, baking powder
menu.prep: Mix ingredients, pour batter on griddle, cook until golden.
menu.origin: Popularized in North America as a staple breakfast dish.

menu.name: Quiche Lorraine
menu.desc: Savory French tart with bacon, cheese, and creamy custard filling.
menu.ingredients: Pie crust, eggs, cream, bacon, cheese
menu.prep: Blind bake crust, prepare custard with eggs and cream, add bacon and cheese, bake until set.
menu.origin: Traditional dish from the Lorraine region of France.

menu.name: Classic Cheesecake
menu.desc: Creamy and smooth cheesecake on a buttery graham cracker crust, topped with a light vanilla glaze.
menu.ingredients: Cream cheese, sugar, eggs, graham crackers, butter, vanilla
menu.prep: Mix cream cheese with sugar and eggs, pour over crust, bake until set.
menu.origin: Popular in New York-style bakeries worldwide.

menu.name: Tiramisu
menu.desc: Layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers with mascarpone cream, dusted with cocoa powder.
menu.ingredients: Ladyfingers, espresso, mascarpone cheese, sugar, cocoa powder
menu.prep: Dip ladyfingers in espresso, layer with mascarpone mixture, chill before serving.
menu.origin: Classic Italian dessert from the Veneto region.

menu.name: Chocolate Mousse
menu.desc: Light and airy dark chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
menu.ingredients: Dark chocolate, eggs, sugar, cream
menu.prep: Melt chocolate, fold into whipped egg whites and cream, chill before serving.
menu.origin: French classic dating back to the 18th century.

menu.name: Apple Pie
menu.desc: Traditional apple pie with spiced filling and a buttery flaky crust.
menu.ingredients: Apples, flour, butter, sugar, cinnamon
menu.prep: Prepare crust, fill with spiced apple mixture, bake until golden.
menu.origin: American favorite served year-round.
